title: raftstore: tikv panicked with `no entry found for key`
body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
master @ c3c9707faed1cf9ef9023f820dd6d1b28285e85f

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->
kubernetes

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
Run jepsen monotonic with the following options
```
{:auto-retry-limit :default,
 :ssh-private-key "jepsen.pem",
 :isolation :repeatable-read,
 :concurrency 15,
 :predicate-read false,
 :tarball-url
 "http://minio.pingcap.net:9000/tp-team/tests/jepsen/tidb-master-linux-amd64.tar.gz",
 :txn-mode "mixed",
 :force-reinstall true,
 :update-in-place false,
 :ssh
 {:username "root",
  :password "root",
  :strict-host-key-checking false,
  :private-key-path "jepsen.pem"},
 :nemesis-long-recovery false,
 :follower-read false,
 :nemesis
 {:interval 10,
  :schedules true,
  :partition-pd-leader true,
  :partition-half true,
  :partition-ring true},
 :nodes
 ["node-0.node-peer.jepsen-tps-810956-1-62"
  "node-1.node-peer.jepsen-tps-810956-1-62"
  "node-2.node-peer.jepsen-tps-810956-1-62"
  "node-3.node-peer.jepsen-tps-810956-1-62"
  "node-4.node-peer.jepsen-tps-810956-1-62"],
 :test-count 1,
 :read-lock "FOR UPDATE",
 :use-index true,
 :os #object[tidb.core.Image 0xe62319f "tidb.core.Image@e62319f"],
 :time-limit 300,
 :recovery-time 10,
 :version "master",
 :auto-retry :default,
 :workload :monotonic,
 :init-txn-sql nil,
 :init-sql
 ("set @@tidb_enable_mutation_checker=1, @@tidb_txn_assertion_level=strict")}
```

### What did you expect?

Test passed.

### What did happened?

Test failed because tikv-server panicked. The full logs can be accessed [here](http://rms.pingcap.net:31714/artifacts/testground/plan-exec-810956/plan-exec-810956-3671234100/archive).
```
[2022/05/26 05:28:00.097 +00:00] [FATAL] [lib.rs:491] ["no entry found for key"] [backtrace="   0: tikv_util::set_panic_hook::{{closure}}\n             at /home/jenkins/agent/workspace/build-common/go/src/github.com/pingcap/tikv/components/tikv_util/src/lib.rs:490:18\n   1: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook\n             at comments_data.body:
```
Guess it was caused by region 8100 being destroyed as a learner, its info in `meta.region_ranges` was not cleaned. https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/666ea1fa568d222b3c67c3ba44d3013b7c119dc9/components/raftstore/src/store/fsm/peer.rs#L3279-L3284

Then when StoreFsm receives a message of an uncreated peer, tries to create the peer, and checks the overlapped regions, it could panic because `meta.region_ranges` and `meta.regions` are inconsistent.
Remove triage related tags for now.
We first met the issue in https://github.com/tikv/tikv/issues/12348 , it's really hard to reproduce.
Now more logs are added, we should get more insight once it's reproduced.

Another panic using the nightly version caused by inconsistent `region_ranges` and `region` in the meta information.
